org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene
Class Scene

java.lang.Object
  org.anddev.andengine.entity.Entity
      org.anddev.andengine.entity.scene.Scene
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUpdateHandler, IEntity, IDrawable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CameraScene, SplashScene
public class Scene
extends Entity

The Scene class is the root container for all objects to be drawn on the screen. A Scene has a specific amount of Layers, which themselves can contain a (fixed or dynamic) amount of Entities. There are subclasses, like the CameraScene/HUD/MenuScene that are drawing themselves to the same position of the Scene no matter where the camera is positioned to.
(c) 2010 Nicolas Gramlich
(c) 2011 Zynga Inc.

Since:
12:47:39 - 08.03.2010
Author:
Nicolas Gramlich

isTouchAreaBindingEnabled

public boolean isTouchAreaBindingEnabled()

setTouchAreaBindingEnabled

public void setTouchAreaBindingEnabled(boolean pTouchAreaBindingEnabled)
Enable or disable the binding of TouchAreas to PointerIDs (fingers). When enabled: TouchAreas get bound to a PointerID (finger) when returning true in Shape.onAreaTouched(TouchEvent, float, float) or IOnAreaTouchListener#onAreaTouched(TouchEvent, ITouchArea, float, float) with TouchEvent.ACTION_DOWN, they will receive all subsequent TouchEvents that are made with the same PointerID (finger) even if the TouchEvent is outside of the actual Scene.ITouchArea!

Parameters:
pTouchAreaBindingEnabled -

isOnSceneTouchListenerBindingEnabled

public boolean isOnSceneTouchListenerBindingEnabled()

setOnSceneTouchListenerBindingEnabled

public void setOnSceneTouchListenerBindingEnabled(boolean pOnSceneTouchListenerBindingEnabled)
Enable or disable the binding of TouchAreas to PointerIDs (fingers). When enabled: The OnSceneTouchListener gets bound to a PointerID (finger) when returning true in Shape.onAreaTouched(TouchEvent, float, float) or IOnAreaTouchListener#onAreaTouched(TouchEvent, ITouchArea, float, float) with TouchEvent.ACTION_DOWN, it will receive all subsequent TouchEvents that are made with the same PointerID (finger) even if the TouchEvent is would belong to an overlaying Scene.ITouchArea!

Parameters:
pOnSceneTouchListenerBindingEnabled -
